channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Did JD Vance just check Kamala Harris' plane out? 'Going to be mine'. Watch
item.description: Both JD Vance and Kamala Harris landed at the same airport in Wisconsin on Wednesday around the same time. But them something 'weird' happened on the tarmac as JD Vance walked over to Air Force Two -- vice president Kamala Harris' plane. The reporters who were travelling with Kamala Harris-Tim Walz were surprised and JD Vance had a ready reply for them.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ISIS terror plot at Taylor Swift concert in Vienna foiled, 2 arrested
item.description: Taylor Swift's upcoming concerts at Vienna were one of the targets of major ISIS plot which has been foiled with the arrest of two men by Austrian federal and state police. Taylor Swift's concerts will take place as scheduled, the police said. Swift is scheduled to perform at the Ernst-Happel-Stadion in Vienna on Thursday, Friday and Saturday for the international leg of The Eras Tour. The shows will not be cancelled.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Karachi banker with Iran ties in foiled plot to kill Trump
item.description: Pakistan announced its communication with US authorities regarding a Pakistani national's alleged role in a failed plot to assassinate former President Donald Trump. The US Justice Department charged Asif Raza Merchant, who allegedly has connections with Tehran. Merchant purportedly sought to recruit individuals for the plot as retaliation for the killing of Iran’s Qasem Soleimani in 2020. He told investigators he has a wife and children in Iran and a separate family in Pakistan.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: JD Vance says Tim Walz lied about military service: 'I went to Iraq but he...'
item.description: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance accused Tim Walz of misleading the country about his veteran status and said he did not actually serve in the army and dropped out when he was asked to go to Iraq. The comment came as Walz made fun of JD Vance's Yale degree followed by his bestseller book attacking the elites.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: German hotel collapse in Moselle wine valley kills two, one guest still trapped
BSF stops hundreds of Bangladeshis 'attempting to sneak into Indian territory'
item.description: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Wednesday prevented a group of over 120-140 Bangladeshi nationals from entering India at the North Bengal frontier. With the help of Border Guard Bangladesh, the group, including women and children, was dispersed. This occurred during violent protests in Bangladesh, forcing Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to resign and flee.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Serena Williams 'denied access' to Paris restaurant, staff explains incident, says ' she was ....'
item.description: Serena Williams criticized a luxury Paris hotel in a social media post after being denied entry to the hotel's rooftop restaurant due to full bookings. ​​Sharing a post on X Williams said: "Yikes @peninsulaparis I've been denied access to rooftop to eat in a empty restaurant of nicer places but never with my kids. Always a first."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris interviewed three for VP pick but Tim Walz got it because...
item.description: A day after Kamala Harris chose Minnesota governor Tim Walz as her running mate in a surprising move sidestepping more popular Josh Shapiro, reports claimed that there was a particular reason why Tim Walz got the gig. His message to Harris was clear that he was not angling for anything else and that's what probably got him the opportunity, reports said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democrats hope Tim Walz will open doors to more white votes for Kamala Harris
item.description: Kamala Harris selected Tim Walz as her vice-presidential pick. Despite facing criticism from MAGA Republicans, Walz brought a folksy charm and broad appeal, especially to white rural and suburban voters. At a Philadelphia rally, he defended his policies and aimed to swing critical voters in key states. His mid-western appeal contrasted sharply with the opposition's tactics.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Watch: Kamala Harris' viral expression when Tim Walz cracks couch joke on JD Vance
item.description: As team Kamala and Tim attended their first rally in Philadelphia, Kamala Harris' reaction to Tim Walz ripping into JD Vance went viral. In a now viral clip, Kamala can be seen looking at Tim in admiration and clapping as Tim said he can't wait to debate JD Vance, Trump's running mate -- provided JD is willing to "get off the couch and show up".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US says Thai party dissolution jeopardizes democracy
item.description: The United States on Wednesday criticized a Thai court's dissolution of the main opposition party, saying it ran against democracy in the longtime US ally. The State Department said it was "deeply concerned" by the decision on the Move Forward Party which "disenfranchises the more than 14 million Thais" who voted for it.

item.title: 'Shocking': Donald Trump calls Tim Walz a smarter version of Kamala Harris
item.description: Former US president and Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump gave his first reaction to his opponent Kamala Harris picking Minnesota Guv Tim Walz as her running mate and said it was a shocking decision. In an interview on Fox & Friends Wednesday morning, Trump said it was an insult to the Jewish people. "He's (Tim Walz) a smarter version of her (Kamala Harris) if you want to know the truth. He is probably the same as Bernie Sanders...there has never been a ticket like this," Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy's prediction about Tim Walz: '...a year from now'
item.description: The VP pick does not even matter in the presidential election but the choice gave a sneak peak into Kamala Harris' decision making that she would cave in to whichever wing put the most pressure, Vivek Ramaswamy said. "She (Kamala Harris) may or may not be ideological, but she showed which wing she’ll ultimately cave to. It’s more revealing than anything she might say in the next 3 months," Vivek said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Kamala Harris a 'communist'? What Elon Musk said
item.description: Elon Musk called US presidential contender Kamala Harris a 'communist' for her stance on equitable distribution. Musk's remark came in response to a post highlighting Harris's support for equitable outcomes. Musk previously endorsed Donald Trump and clarified misinformation about his financial contributions to Trump's campaign, denying donations of $45 million per month.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Akasa @2: ‘Will be among world’s top 30 airlines by end of decade,’ says Vinay Dube
item.description: ​​ Despite facing uncertainty over aircraft deliveries from embattled Boeing, Dube assured employees that “we are poised to grow faster than many thought possible” and that Akasa is the “only Indian airline in history to reach a firm book order of this size (226 MAX) within 17 months of commencing operations…. Laying the foundation for unprecedented growth.”
item.dc:creator: Saurabh Sinha

item.title: Nearly 40,000 and counting: The struggle to keep track of Gaza deaths
Bangladesh crisis: Was Sheikh Hasina ousted in a coup orchestrated by army chief Waker-Uz-Zaman?
item.description: Bangladesh's army chief, Waker-Uz-Zaman, directed his officers not to fire on protestors enforcing Sheikh Hasina's curfew, resulting in her losing military support. "Hasina no longer had the army's support," an Indian official familiar with the situation said.​​ Following deadly clashes, Hasina fled the country and resigned. Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus is set to return to lead an interim government amid ongoing unrest.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Thai court dissolves progressive Move Forward Party, which won election but failed to take power
item.description: The Constitutional Court said it voted unanimously to dissolve the party because its campaign to amend the law was considered an attempt to overthrow the nation's constitutional monarchy.

item.title: Peta protesters interrupt Pope Francis' Vatican audience, call on him to denounce bullfighting
item.description: During Pope Francis' general audience, two Peta activists interrupted the event with banners and t-shirts protesting bullfighting, calling it a sin. Peta has urged the Pope to sever the Catholic Church's association with bullfighting. The Vatican has yet to comment, but such protests have led to mounting criticism of the blood sport linked to Catholic traditions.

item.title: Turkey to submit request to join genocide case against Israel in UN court
item.description: The declaration of intervention will be submitted at the International Court of Justice in The Hague, the official said on condition of anonymity in line with regulations that bar officials from speaking to the media without prior authorization
